references.reason: This paper introduces a novel algorithm for solving large imperfect-information games, which is highly relevant to the poker AI research discussed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Superhuman AI for heads-up no-limit poker: Libratus beats top professionals
references.reason: This paper reports on a significant milestone in AI game playing, where the Libratus AI defeated top human poker players, showcasing the power of AI in complex strategic games.
This paper extends the success of Libratus to multiplayer poker, further advancing the state-of-the-art in AI game playing and demonstrating the scalability of advanced AI techniques.

references.paper_title: Mastering the game of Go with deep neural networks and tree search
references.reason: This paper details the AlphaGo system which achieved superhuman performance in the game of Go, providing a benchmark for AI capabilities in complex strategic games and highlighting the significance of deep learning.

This paper is a foundational work in game theory that provides the theoretical basis for understanding games with incomplete information, such as poker, which is essential to the research presented in the main paper.
